Rotary is an organization of business and professional leaders united worldwide who provide humanitarian service, encourage high ethical standards in all vocations, and help build goodwill and peace in the world. In more than 160 countries worldwide, approximately 1.2 million Rotarians belong to more than 30,000 Rotary clubs.

teams.name: Mars Hill Lending Team
teams.description:
From 2007 to 2012, the Mars Hill community invested $1.2 million dollars to support the efforts of Turame Community Finance in Burundi, Africa. Now we are continuing our involvement with Turame in an even more hands-on-way - by becoming microfinance lenders. 

How to get involved:
1. Click the join team button to the left [if you are new to Kiva you will need to create an account].

2. Choose a Borrower: Check out the current Turame loans by scrolling down at this link: [http://bit.ly/pGU0sd] If there are no new loans, check back in as Turame posts new loans twice a month.

3. Make a Loan:

4. Get Repaid: Over the course of 6 months your loan will get repaid to you in the form of Kiva credit. [This is a loan, not a donation]

5. Repeat.  You can take the money and put it back in your pocket or make a loan to another group.

Thanks for helping support Turame Community Finance in providing loans to those living in one of the poorest countries on the planet. 
You can learn more about Turame here: www.kiva.org/partners/162

teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

You can do it too!

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: Kiva Jews
teams.loan_because: Tikkun Olam - making the world a better place.
teams.description: One of Judaism's most famous scholars, Maimonides, said that the highest form of charity is to help someone no longer need charity - and lending to Kiva does that.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Jewish Lending Group
teams.loan_because:
"The greatest level, is to support a fellow by endowing him with a gift or loan, or entering into a partnership with him, or finding employment for him, in order to strengthen his hand until he need no longer be dependent upon others." - Maimonides' Eight Levels of Charity 

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------                                                                                                 
"If we donate only to Jewish causes or to individual Jews in need, we may stop seeing everyone as being equally created in God's image and therefore worthy of our help. After all, we are all members of one race, the human race." -- Rabbi Joseph Telushkin
teams.description: Jews and non-Jews from around the world who want to help improve the world, one step at a time.

teams.name: St. Thomas Academy
teams.loan_because: We care
teams.description: STA is a Catholic boys school in Minnesota. The class of 2014 started this team and we intend to make it grow.

teams.name: Poverty2Prosperity.org - Poverty-Escape
teams.loan_because: Poverty2Prosperity.org (P2P) is all about Poverty-Escape. Please join our fun team and put Poverty-Escape in the lead!  See how to get your I'm a Kiva Loaner Bracelet and more by participating on Team P2P - visit our web site for details!
teams.description:
One of P2P's major poverty-escaping projects is to participate in making microloans through the Kiva platform. See the web site for details on all of our projects. Also see our Perpetual Fund lender account which allows people to designate funds for perpetual loaning here on Kiva, http://www.kiva.org/lender/P2PPerpetualFund

We have a special purpose fund to keep loans from expiring. Please join us at http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans to see currently funding loans from the SOS Loan fund.

NOTE:  Poverty2Prosperity is also a non-profit, and any messages not related to Kiva or Poverty2Prosperity may be deleted.  If there is an idea you would like to share, contact one of the Team Captains to get permission.  Thank you for your consideration.

teams.name: Unitarian Universalists
teams.loan_because:
We believe in:
**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large
**The goal of world community with peace, liberty, and justice for all
**Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.
teams.description:
We are UU congregations and individuals (including those who describe themselves as "active" or "backslid" or "interested friends" or "just looking") throughout the world. 
For more information on us, or to find a congregation near you, check out the main website for the Unitarian Universalist Association

teams.name: Kiva U Colleges
teams.description:
Kiva U-College is an international network of microfinance clubs that gives university students an easy way to play a direct role in changing lives. Kiva U's mission is to educate students about the potential impact of microfinance, and to encourage microlending through Kiva's lending teams. 

Kiva U is world-wide and it continues to grow. In the coming school year, Kiva U will provide its chapters with the infrastructure and resources they need to establish a permanent presence on campus. The program will offer its chapters a variety of opportunities to participate in competitions and conferences, and will strongly encourage intra-university collaboration.

teams.name: Kiva Detroit
teams.loan_because: We want to champion small businesses in Detroit!
teams.description:
Kiva Detroit is the first Kiva City, a program where Kiva works with community organizations in the United States to provide local small businesses with microloans. 

The goal of the Kiva Detroit team is to empower Detroiters to champion local small businesses through Kiva. 

To double your impact, your loan to a Kiva Detroit borrower will be matched 1-to-1 by the Knight Foundation

teams.name: Smile Train
teams.loan_because:
There are millions of children with unrepaired cleft lips and palates who have little to no prospect of ever being helped. Their parents are so poor they could never afford surgery. Being born with a cleft in a developing country is truly a curse, and no one knows how many newborns with clefts are killed or abandoned right after birth.  

Through Smile Train's free cleft surgery program, a 45 minute surgery gives these children a future and a second chance at life that they never thought they'd get. Let's change the world, one smile at a time!

Through our Kiva lending we want to raise awareness and support of the wonderful work Smile Train does in providing free cleft repair surgeries around the world. If our team logo is displayed on loans' top lending teams we hope other Kiva lenders will learn about Smile Train's work too.  Won't you join us?
.
teams.description:
We are a diverse group of Kiva lenders from different backgrounds and different areas of the world who share a common desire to support the effort to bring a repair surgery to every child who needs one.  Our team also includes staff members of Smile Train and Kiva and other microfinance ventures.  We would be happy for you to join our team too!

The little girl in our team logo is Pinki Sonkar.  She was born with a severe cleft into a family that was surviving on less than a dollar a day in a poor rural village in India. She could not go to school because the other children threw rocks at her.  Smile Pinki tells the story of how her life was changed forever by a free repair surgery at a Smile Train partner hospital.  Contact a team captain for more information if you would like a free DVD of this Academy Award winning documentary.

Where is Pinki Now - http://bit.ly/WhereisPinkiNow - This 5 minute video has interviews with Pinki's parents and teachers and video of Pinki in school.  You can see that cleft surgery brings a total transformation to the lives of these kids.

Wang Li Got Married - http://bit.ly/WangLi - this video tells the moving story of Smile Train's very first patient and how her life was totally changed.

Smile Train in Mexico - http://bit.ly/SmileMexico - this video is for Adrin and the Arenal Group. As a team we loaned to help his parents, and we hope that through Smile Train Adrin will get the care that he needs.

Kiva Team Smile Train fund raiser page - http://bit.ly/DonateTeamSmileTrain - If you would like to make donation to support Smile Train's work you can do so here.  Even if you don't make a donation, please sign our guest book!      Thank you for helping the kids!      

Other tax advantaged donation links:
Canada - http://www.canadahelps.org/CharityProfilePage.aspx?CharityID=s98822
Great Britain - http://www.smiletrain.org.uk/
India - http://www.smiletrainindia.org/
Italy - http://www.smiletrain.it/

Check out the distribution of our team's impact around the world:  http://kivafolio.appspot.com/report?user=Smile_Train

Check our team statistics:  http://smiletrain.vijayr.net/stats.php
.

teams.name: Happy Kiva Lenders
teams.description:
We Happy Kiva Lenders think Kiva is great and are happy to see Kiva lending to everyone including US citizens.  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
People in need are people in need regardless of where they live.
- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Our Goal is to show our support for Kiva's decision to fight poverty everywhere!
Please join us Happy Kiva Lenders and showing your support for Kiva by lending to whomever you want! 

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 

 You can help in 3 ways - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -   
1) Join this team! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
2) Make a loan!  - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 
3) Share this page with your friends! - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -  - - - - - -  

 - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - 


Through our numbers and our loans we'll let Kiva know that they have our support in fighting poverty everywhere!

teams.name: XacBank - Mongolia
teams.loan_because: We believe XacBank has the vision, scale and innovation to better the lives of the Mongolian people
teams.description: People who care about Mongolia and would like to stay connected to it

teams.name: Anarres Natural Health Community
teams.loan_because:
Anarres Natural Health is an ethical green business. I am contributing what I can to society through my work.

Anarres strives to be as ethical and environmentally friendly as possible. I want to use this privilege I have of being born into an affluent society by sharing some of that affluence.
teams.description: Anarres Natural Health's team will consist of myself (natural health practitioner) and subscribers, clients, fans and other members of my community.

teams.name: Team CANADA
teams.loan_because:
So little means so much. And because we are so fortunate to be able to lend with the luxury of not worrying about whether we ever see that money again, while the clients borrow with the hope and determination that they will be able to repay, and improve their lives along the way.

Check out fundraising loans already being supported by Team Canada:
http://www.kiva.org/team/team_canada/loans?status=fundRaising
teams.description: We're Canadian, eh?

We aim to decrease world suck.

www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik

We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

teams.name: Gaza on My Mind
teams.loan_because: We would like to help Palestinians under occupation to make a life for themselves.
teams.description: Interested in the human side of the Palestine Question.

teams.name: IEP School
teams.loan_because: Helping others is important to us and for us. It creates compassion and helps us to look outside of ourselves to the millions of people in the world who could use our help.
teams.description: We are a Non-public special education school that deals with kids who have behavioral needs.

teams.name: Palestinian Development Network
teams.loan_because: We believe in micro-lending and we want to help hard working Palestinians prosper and earn a better future for themselves, their families and their communities.
teams.description: We are a group of friends, family and like-minded individuals who want to see a better future for the Palestinian people and want to support the efforts of hard working men and women throughout the Palestinian territories.  Please, join us!

teams.name: City of Berkeley
teams.loan_because: Bit by bit we make a change.

teams.name: Jussis vnner
teams.loan_because: we care

teams.name: Unitarian Universalists
teams.loan_because:
We believe in:
**The inherent worth and dignity of every person
**Justice, equity and compassion in human relations
**Acceptance of one another and encouragement to spiritual growth in our congregations
**A free and responsible search for truth and meaning
**The right of conscience and the use of the democratic process within our congregations and in society at large
**The goal of world community with peace, liberty, and justice for all
**Respect for the interdependent web of all existence of which we are a part.
teams.description:
We are UU congregations and individuals (including those who describe themselves as "active" or "backslid" or "interested friends" or "just looking") throughout the world. 
For more information on us, or to find a congregation near you, check out the main website for the Unitarian Universalist Association

teams.name: Countryside Church Unitarian Universalist
teams.loan_because: We believe in turning our church covenant into action!
teams.description: Members of Countryside Church Unitarian Universalist believe in helping others to improve their lives. We believe in the worth and dignity of every person.

teams.name: Social Action Committee NSUC
teams.loan_because: we value fellowship, justice and compassion.
teams.description: Members and friends of the Social Action Committee of North Shore Unitarian Church

teams.name: Kiva Kiwis
teams.loan_because: Because Kiwis know what it is to pull yourself  up by your bootstraps.
teams.description: Started in Oamaru New Zealand by a group of friends wanting to encourage and to make it easy for Kiwis to make loans through Kiva.

teams.name: Lauren's Lenders
teams.description: I decided to give Kiva gift certificates for Chrismas 2009, and I want my friends and family to be able to follow each others' loans.

teams.loan_because: We support the mission of helping people to realize their own dreams
teams.description: A group committed to outreach based on belief in Christian love and dignity of all people

teams.name: LGB Invest
teams.loan_because: It's a small world.

teams.name: Give Green - Environmental Loans
teams.loan_because: We want the world to be a better place.
teams.description:
Made of individual kiva lenders who are concerned about the environmental impacts of their loans. This is a forum to notify each other of environmentally sustainable loans that are needing funding. Sustainable development projects include recycling, solar, re-use, organic agriculture, health, etc. 

We support enterprises that care about the earth and all of its inhabitants. We have no religious, racial or political affiliations of any kind. We want to encourage sustainable enterprises that recycle, reuse, repurpose and use environmentally sound agricultural and manufacturing practices. 
Many of us would like Kiva to develop environmental standards or criteria for their lending practices to prevent environmental impacts that would increase poverty for future generations.
Many people want to have a green portfolio, or at least a green component. 
Won't you join us in creating true sustainability that includes a healthy environment?

teams.name: Team Reddit!
teams.loan_because: We redditors believe change is something that we should all take responsibility for.
teams.description: A group of people from the social news website reddit - started not by reddit admins, but by redditors themselves.

teams.name: Team California
teams.loan_because: Our state rules and we care about the world around us!
teams.description: We are from the great state of California!

teams.name: Jussis vnner
teams.loan_because: we care

teams.name: Buddhists for World Peace
teams.loan_because: Peace is our focus and helping others to create success and happiness for their self and community leads to peace and is the boddhisatva way.
teams.description: Many in body, one in mind.

teams.name: Seattle Pacific University
teams.loan_because: we believe in the transformative power micro-finance can have on poor communities!
teams.description: We are a group of students, faculty and alumni who support micro-finance activities around the world

teams.name: Kiva: A Festivus Miracle
teams.loan_because: Between the Airing of Grievances and the Feats of Strength, we micro-lend.

teams.name: Smithmas
teams.loan_because: lending people money on Kiva is more useful and fun than many other gifts we could give each other.
teams.description: We are all family members

teams.name: Di Bari Wines
teams.loan_because: We believe that everyone who enjoys a life of plenty should give back.  Both in the local community, and in the global market, giving should know no boundaries.
teams.description: As a budding company in the wine industry, we recognize the dedication it takes to be an entrepreneur.  We are excited to see other companies grow as we do.

teams.name: Norway
teams.loan_because:
We have Cold Weather - Warm hearts !
We believe that providing microloans to entrepreneurs in developing countries is the socially responsive way of helping people break the circle of poverty. 

We promote Kiva.org as a sustainable and transparent way of connecting lenders and borrowers from across the globe.
teams.description:
Bruk denne linken for  invitere dine venner til teamet her:
http://www.kiva.org/team/norway/recruit

Det er flott hvis du trykker Facebook "anbefale/recommend" knappen oppe til hyre  p denne siden. Vr facebookgruppe: http://www.facebook.com/pages/Kiva-Norway/193432017389484

Anbefalte ln "sikrere" ln: 
http://www.kiva.org/lend?sortBy=partner_default_min=0&partner_default_max=0.5&partner_risk_rating_min=1&partner_risk_rating_max=5&partner_arrears_min=0&partner_arrears_max=1.1&sortBy=repaymentTerm
Hjelp med "expiring loans": http://poverty2prosperity.org/sosloans/#fundraising_loans

Hjelp med "postdisbursed" ln:
http://kivatools.com/fundraising/postdisbursedloans

Kiva tools:
https://www.kiva.org/portfolio/collections
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kiva-country-collector/
http://www.bhodisoft.com/kfpc/
http://www.kivalens.org

Da har vi ndd mlet p 2 million dollar utlnt. Takk til alle som har bidratt!

teams.description: Hello, world. Our team was formed to demonstrate the presence of NYU alumni, students, faculty, staff, and their awesome friends within the Kiva lending community. The group is open, and people are welcome to join, as desired.

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Kingdom Tide
teams.loan_because: 80 should trickle down to 20

teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.

teams.name: Marie Forleo's Kiva Lending Team
teams.whereabouts: Global Baby!  HQ in NYC & LA
teams.loan_because: We're uber passionate about making a difference.  Nothing makes us more excited than using our skills and resources to increase prosperity, aliveness and well-being on the planet.
teams.description: We're a global group of creators committed to doing our best work, giving back and having a GREAT time while we do it!  Wanna join us? Requirements:  a can-do-attitude, sense of humor, a passion for possibility, and burning desire to use your creativity to be of service!

teams.name: Team Shrimp 'n Grits
teams.loan_because: Micro-finance, as it has been realized by Kiva.org, is one of the most promising and reliable mechanisms for ending extreme poverty.
teams.description: We are a team of friends primarily from Indiana with members from around the country.  We all agree that living in the United States is a privilege that should not be taken for granted.  Making a difference in the lives of individuals and, respectively, their country's economy is important to our team.  We agree we live in a global community where our decisions affect more than the people closest to us.

teams.name: Team PBS
teams.loan_because: Helping others help themselves, we hope to make the world a better place
teams.description: book lovers and hope givers

teams.name: Emphasizing The Positive
teams.whereabouts: Snohomish and many more pockets of good
teams.loan_because: We want to encourage more ripple effects of goodness to reach far and wide.

teams.name: Kiva Walk
teams.loan_because: Because we know the benefit of someone providing a 'hand up' both in our work and throughout our life.
teams.description: Founded by a 8.5 month walk across the USA in 2010, the KivaWalk Lending Team is a growing movement of Kiva champions that use walking to teach and instill Kiva's mission while also connecting us to the profound benefits of life at 3mph.

teams.name: College of William & Mary
teams.loan_because: We believe in the power of microfinance and support capitalist principles in developing nations.
teams.description: Go Tribe!  We are W&M alumni, family, and friends.

teams.name: rowers
teams.loan_because: pull together for success
teams.description: oarsome!

teams.name: ANU Philosophy
teams.description: People associated, in one way or another, with the philosophy program at the Australian National University. Visitors, sympathisers, interested .. anyone is welcome to join.

teams.name: Team USA
teams.loan_because: We believe in the generosity of the human spirit that is still alive within Americans of all backgrounds.

teams.name: Saint John's University / College of Saint Benedict
teams.loan_because: Our experience at St. John's and St. Ben's instilled in us the dedication and drive to seek out and serve the greater good, wherever we find it.
teams.description: Alums from Saint John's University and the College of Saint Benedict; two schools which teach the importance of finding your place in a global context and helping others do the same.

teams.name: women empowering women
teams.loan_because: empower a woman, change the world.

teams.name: Kivans Against Cockfighting Loans
teams.loan_because: KACL believes in the power of microloans and the potential of Kiva, but we believe Kiva should not list loans related to Cockfighting (or Dog Fighting, Bull Fighting, or any other blood sports).
teams.description: We want to help people escape poverty, and avoid the promotion and celebration of extreme cruelty.

teams.name: Weddingfavours.ca
teams.loan_because: It's a great opportunity to help other small businesses around the world.
teams.description: Employees, friends and customers of Weddingfavours.ca in Ingersoll, Ontario

teams.name: Australia
teams.loan_because:
Australians all let us rejoice
for we are young and free,    -   
We've heard the call of nations wide,
How can we let this be?    -   
We'll share our wealth,
We'll make the change,
We'll help to set them free   -   
From us to them
and back again, 
As one we all shall be      - 

(Thanks to member Jean for this one)

Find us on Facebook at http://www.facebook.com/group.php?gid=97953452142
teams.description: Kiva Loaners in Australia

teams.name: Kiva Christians
teams.loan_because:
Pure and undefiled religion before God the Father is this: to care for orphans and widows in their misfortune and to keep oneself unstained by the world. (Jam. 1:27) http://whoisjesus-really.com/

Link to information regarding Christian partners       
http://goo.gl/LU3hzz
teams.description: A group of believers in Jesus Christ, brought together through a common purpose: to help those in need around the world.

teams.name: Atheists, Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists and the Non-Religious
teams.loan_because: We care about human beings and understand that it takes people to help people.
teams.description:
We are one human family, and we know that people can do good without believing in a god.

The Plus sign in the A+ Team logo reflects the fact that the team comprises Atheists, PLUS Agnostics, Skeptics, Freethinkers, Secular Humanists, and Non-Religious members.  A+ is also a symbol of excellence.

***TEAM WEBSITE***
http://apluskiva.wordpress.com/

***TEAM RESOURCES***

http://goo.gl/wtDkJ

www.tinyurl.com/AASFSHNR-MFIs

teams.name: The Abraham Group
teams.loan_because: That we may be a blessing to all nations on the earth.
teams.description: Christian

teams.name: Pamela and Warren Nowak Memorial
teams.loan_because: Pamela and Warren Nowak were good people and now they are at Rest and at Peace. We miss them, we are Happy for them, and we keep their Spirits alive by helping others.
teams.description: This is a Memorial to keep helping others in the name of Pamela and Warren Nowak.

teams.name: New York
teams.loan_because: New York is full of entrepreneurs so we want to support others around the world, and give them the opportunity to alleviate themselves out of poverty.
teams.description:
We are a group of like minded New Yorkers who connect to make a difference.

Please note, Team Message unrelated to Kiva New York team lending & activities may be deleted.  Please keep posts related to the team!

http://gplus.to/kivany

teams.name: Friends of Bob Harris
teams.loan_because:
After stumbling into a job as a luxury travel writer, I saw so much poverty that I decided to turn those paychecks into Kiva loans. Then I visited a bunch of clients, who were amazing, and I've written a book about it called "The International Bank of Bob" (Walker/Bloomsbury, March 5, 2013).

I hope the book will get more people to feel a greater understanding of Kiva, a better appreciation of the role of microfinance, and most of all, more connected to the rest of the world.
teams.description: People who realize that if we switched places with the recipients, they'd loan to us just as happily.  So, fair's fair.

teams.name: Nerdfighters
teams.loan_because:
We aim to decrease world suck.

And this is how:
www.eludehcs.no/kiva/nerdfighters/nerdfighters20120916.png by Nerdfighter Ole Bendik
teams.description:
We're Nerdfighters! We fight against suck; we fight for awesome! We fight using our brains, our hearts, our calculators, and our trombones.

Happy lending!

Follow us on twitter: https://twitter.com/KivaNerds

teams.name: Capital to the Coast 2011
teams.loan_because: We want to make a difference, and believe that micro-loans are a great way to empower people and reduce poverty worldwide.
teams.description: In cycling from Ottawa to Halifax, nearly 1500 km, in ten days, we want to promote the work of micro-loans, and encourage and inspire people to lend through Kiva, and make a sustainable and measurable difference.

teams.name: Brown University
teams.loan_because: we believe that micro-credit lending should not be restricted to large institutions, but is an initiative that students should understand and strive to be a part of.
teams.description: Student of Brown University, USA.

teams.name: Vegetarians and Vegans on Kiva
teams.loan_because: We have a vision of a healthier, more compassionate and sustainable world. Hard work is often not enough to escape poverty and we gladly welcome the opportunity to give people and their businesses a fighting chance. Our team focus is on making loans to borrowers who don't use animals in their businesses.
teams.description: We're vegetarians and vegans, and those thinking about making the change.  We welcome everyone regardless of their motivation for going veggie.

teams.name: Team PBS
teams.loan_because: Helping others help themselves, we hope to make the world a better place
teams.description: book lovers and hope givers

teams.name: Soule Family
teams.loan_because: it's a great way to encourage entrepreneurship and affect lives around the world.
teams.description: Descendants of Mayflower Pilgrim George Soule

teams.name: Luther College
teams.loan_because: We believe in serving each other as part of our daily lives. We believe in peace without borders.
teams.description:
A conscious team that promotes peace and tries to eradicate extreme poverty in the most needed places. 

We invite students/faculty/staff/alumni/families to join the group.
